name: Mushroom Network
the-point: Fungi create an 'underground internet' that allows trees to communicate and share nutrients.

name: Oldest Living Thing
the-point: There is a seagrass meadow in the Mediterranean that is estimated to be 200,000 years old.

name: Bee Flight
the-point: According to the laws of aerodynamics, bees shouldn't be able to fly; they just move their wings too fast for the math.

name: The Great Barrier Reef
the-point: The Great Barrier Reef is the largest living structure on Earth and can be seen from space.

name: Plant Intelligence
the-point: Can plants actually 'hear' or 'feel' when they are being eaten?

name: Deep Sea Life
the-point: We have explored less than 5% of the Earth's oceans.

name: Ant Population
the-point: For every human on Earth, there are roughly 2.5 million ants.

name: Eternal Jellyfish
the-point: The Turritopsis dohrnii jellyfish can essentially live forever by reverting back to its baby state.

name: Lightning Strikes
the-point: Lightning strikes the Earth about 100 times every second.

name: Tree Intelligence
the-point: Mother trees will purposely 'starve' themselves to give more nutrients to their saplings.

name: Volcanic Ash
the-point: Volcanic ash isn't soft like wood ash; it's actually tiny shards of glass and rock.

name: Plastic Problem
the-point: Every piece of plastic ever made still exists somewhere on Earth today.

name: Dolphin Names
the-point: Dolphins have 'signature whistles' that act as individual names for each other.

name: Water Age
the-point: The water you drink today is the same water that dinosaurs drank millions of years ago.

name: Bird Migration
the-point: Some birds use the Earth's magnetic field like a built-in GPS to fly thousands of miles.

name: Sahara Snow
the-point: It has snowed in the Sahara Desert multiple times in the last 40 years.

name: Oxygen Source
the-point: Most of the world's oxygen comes from plankton in the ocean, not trees on land.

name: Panda Diet
the-point: Pandas have to eat for 12 hours a day because bamboo has almost zero nutritional value.

name: Animal Sleep
the-point: Sharks and dolphins sleep with one eye open and half their brain awake.

name: Mount Everest
the-point: The summit of Mount Everest is actually marine limestone, meaning it was once under the sea.

name: Butterfly Liquid
the-point: Butterflies taste with their feet and can only eat liquids.

name: The Amazon River
the-point: The Amazon River discharges enough water into the ocean to fill 8,000 Olympic swimming pools every second.

name: Chameleon Camouflage
the-point: Chameleons change color based on mood and temperature, not just to blend into their surroundings.

name: Antarctic Deserts
the-point: Antarctica is technically the largest desert in the world because it gets almost no rainfall.

name: Rewilding
the-point: If humans disappeared today, nature would reclaim most cities within just 50 years.
